result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yesiand Arnardo Cruz

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Violation (New Criminal Charges) Report

Defendant Yesiand Arnardo Cruz appeared by video.  Attorney Dean Douglas Sopcic appeared by video for Yesiand Arnardo Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has offer and discovery and requests additional time to review with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EVM.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Yesiand Arnardo Cruz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III appeared by video for Yesiand Arnardo Cruz.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
